summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing logistics for digitizing and transferring files related to the Epstein case. The Office of General Counsel denied turning files over to SONY for copying, but Doclab agreed to expedite digitization by approximately July 10, 2019. The files needed to be FedEx'd to Virginia.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Participant in email chain discussing logistics for digitizing and transferring Epstein case files.

events.title: Expected digitization completion
events.description: Doclab agreed to expedite and get the files digitized by approximately July 10, 2019.

events.title: Email correspondence on file transfer
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss OGC denying file transfer to SONY, Doclab expediting digitization, and need to FedEx files to Virginia.

keyFacts: The FBI's Office of General Counsel (OGC) denied turning Epstein case files over to SONY for copying.
Doclab agreed to expedite digitization of the files, with an expected completion date of approximately July 10, 2019.
The files needed to be physically transferred via FedEx to Virginia.
